name: Travis Scott
description:
'''Jacques Bermon Webster II''' (born April 30, 1991), known professionally as '''Travis Scott''' (formerly stylized as '''Travi$ Scott'''), is an American rapper, songwriter, and record producer. Scott has had five number-one hits on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] chart, along with a total of over one hundred charting songs. In addition to ten [[Grammy Award]] nominations, he has won a [[Latin Grammy Award]], [[Billboard Music Award|''Billboard'' Music Award]], [[MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Award]], and several [[BET Hip Hop Awards]]. Scott's musical style has been described as a "blend between traditional [[hip-hop]] and [[Lo-fi music|lo-fi]]" and often characterized as "[[Ambient music|ambient]]," drawing notable influence from rappers [[Kanye West]] and [[Kid Cudi]]. His stage name is derived from the latter's real name, Scott Mescudi, combined with the name of a favorite uncle.

In 2012, Scott signed his first [[Major record label|major-label]] recording contract with [[Epic Records]], as well as a publishing deal with Kanye West's [[GOOD Music]] as an in-house producer. In April 2013, he entered a joint-venture record deal with Georgia-based rapper [[T.I.]]'s [[Grand Hustle Records]]. Scott [[self-released]] his first full-length project, a [[mixtape]] titled ''[[Owl Pharaoh]]'' in 2013, which was followed by his debut mixtape, ''[[Days Before Rodeo]]'' (2014). His debut studio album, ''[[Rodeo (Travis Scott album)|Rodeo]]'' (2015), was met with critical and commercial success; it spawned the singles "[[3500]]" (featuring [[Future (rapper)|Future]] and [[2 Chainz]]) and "[[Antidote (Travis Scott song)|Antidote]]", the latter peaked at number 16 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. His second album, ''[[Birds in the Trap Sing McKnight]]'' (2016), became his first number-one album on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart. In the following year, Scott formed the duo [[Huncho Jack]] with rapper [[Quavo]], with whom he released an [[Huncho Jack, Jack Huncho|eponymous collaborative album]] (2017).

Scott's third studio album, ''[[Astroworld (album)|Astroworld]]'' (2018), was released to widespread critical acclaim and became his second consecutive number-one album on the ''Billboard'' 200. It yielded his first ''Billboard'' Hot 100 number-one single, "[[Sicko Mode]]" (featuring [[Drake (musician)|Drake]]). In late 2019, Scott's [[vanity label]] imprint, [[Cactus Jack Records]], released the compilation album ''[[JackBoys]]'', which also topped the ''Billboard'' 200. With his 2019 single "[[Highest in the Room]]" and his 2020 singles "[[The Scotts]]" (with [[Kid Cudi]]) and "[[Franchise (song)|Franchise]]" (featuring [[Young Thug]] and [[M.I.A. (rapper)|M.I.A.]]), Scott became the first artist on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 to have three songs debut at number one in less than a year. Following a series of controversies and five years after the release of his previous solo album, Scott released [[Utopia (Travis Scott album)|''Utopia'']] (2023), which became his fourth consecutive number-one album on the ''Billboard'' 200 and spawned the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 top-ten singles "[[Meltdown (Travis Scott song)|Meltdown]]" (featuring Drake), "[[Fein (song)|Fein]]" (featuring [[Playboi Carti]]), and "[[K-pop (Travis Scott, Bad Bunny and the Weeknd song)|K-pop]]" (with [[Bad Bunny]] and [[The Weeknd]]). In 2025, he released the single "[[4x4 (song)|4x4]]", which peaked atop the ''Billboard'' Hot 100. His second collaboration with JackBoys, ''[[JackBoys 2]]'', charted atop the ''Billboard'' 200, making it Scott's sixth consecutive number-one album overall on the chart.

Along with his highly publicized relationship with American media personality [[Kylie Jenner]], Scott has collaborated with organizations including [[Nike, Inc.|Nike]], [[Dior]], and [[McDonald's]]. His Cactus Jack record label, founded in 2017, has signed artists including [[Don Toliver]] and [[Sheck Wes]]. Scott has gained notoriety for controversies and legal issues regarding concert safety. In November 2021, a [[Astroworld Festival crowd crush|mass-casualty crowd crush]] occurred during Scott's hometown performance at his annual [[Astroworld Festival]], causing ten deaths and hundreds of injuries.
